intro: Ferocactus bicolor var. bolaensis, commonly known as the Bolaños ferocactus, is a species native to the Baja California Peninsula. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its ribbed stem and dense clusters of spines. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to full sun and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
